description.description:
ActiveFence is a leading platform for Trust & Safety teams worldwide, leveraging cutting‑edge AI and world‑class expertise to protect users from the widest spectrum of online harms. By continuously collecting and analyzing data, our solutions ensure customers stay two steps ahead of bad actors in an ever‑changing threat landscape.
We’re seeking an outstanding 
Backend Engineer with a Generative AI orientation
 to join our research team. We are building a new AI Platform from scratch to standardize AI development methods, ensure excellence and efficiency, and deliver robust, scalable, and compliant AI capabilities. This platform will handle GenAI models deployment, prompt management, data filtering, logging, and monitoring, centrally, so individuals can focus on their own business-specific logic.
Key Responsibilities
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines that support fast, reliable integration and deployment of GenAI systems across complex environments, including orchestrating multiple models/agents and MCP clients/servers.
Develop, deploy and integrate AI solutions and agentic frameworks, creating both command‑line tools and interactive notebooks that support our team’s research and workflow automation needs.
Build and manage data pipelines and databases (SQL) for large‑scale data handling, automating data collection and curation (e.g., adversarial prompts for model red-teaming) to support AI training and evaluation.
Integrate research into production by implementing the latest generative AI advancements (including white‑box LLM development), integrating different models and agents, and developing evaluation frameworks (e.g., agentic reasoning tests) as part of our automated workflows.
Deploy GenAI models from repositories such as HuggingFace onto our AWS platform, connect them to data pipelines, and automate end‑to‑end processes for prompt generation, labeling, and response evaluation.
description.requirements:
Must
B.Sc. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent hands‑on experience).
5+ years of experience delivering large‑scale, high‑performance systems on AWS, with an emphasis on orchestrating data pipelines and AI workflows in production environments.
Expertise in scripting and automation using Python and shell; proven ability to write clean IaC and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong understanding of Linux systems, networking, and distributed system design.
Ability to break down monolithic systems into scalable, loosely coupled services and microservices.
Strong cross‑functional communication and collaboration skills, with a DevOps mindset to drive best practices across teams.
Hands‑on experience deploying and integrating generative AI models (e.g., large language models or other AI/ML models) in production.
Hands‑on experience deploying MCP clients/servers and integrating them into automated AI workflows.
Nice-to-Have
M.Sc. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
Experience with large‑scale cluster management or HPC scheduling tools (e.g., Slurm).
Knowledge of advanced observability and monitoring tools such as Prometheus and Grafana.
Experience with cloud cost optimization (FinOps concepts) and exposure to infrastructure security tools or configuration management for compliance.
Hands‑on experience working with A2A protocol.
description.about activefence:
ActiveFence is the leading provider of security and safety solutions for online experiences, safeguarding more than 3 billion users, top foundation models, and the world’s largest enterprises and tech platforms every day. 
As a trusted ally to major technology firms and Fortune 500 brands that build user-generated and GenAI products, ActiveFence empowers security, AI, and policy teams with low-latency Real-Time Guardrails and a continuous Red Teaming program that pressure-tests systems with adversarial prompts and emerging threat techniques. Powered by deep threat intelligence, unmatched harmful-content detection, and coverage of 117+ languages, ActiveFence enables organizations to deliver engaging and trustworthy experiences at global scale while operating safely and responsibly across all threat landscapes.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking an experienced Malware Research Director to build and manage multiple teams dedicated to malware research and review. This role presents an exciting opportunity to establish a new operation from the ground up, including recruiting top talent, creating processes, and setting up cross-team collaboration while serving as the primary client interface.
The position is primarily leadership and client-facing, requiring exceptional team-building and operational setup skills. The ideal candidate demonstrates proven experience in building teams from scratch, establishing new operations, and strong client relationship management capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
Build and recruit multiple teams of malware researchers from scratch
Establish operational processes, workflows, and quality standards for the new teams
Coordinate with other departments to integrate the new operation into the existing infrastructure
Serve as primary client interface, managing relationships and ensuring client satisfaction
Present research findings and malicious evidence to clients and stakeholders
Create training programs and onboarding processes for new team members
Develop performance metrics and evaluation frameworks for team effectiveness
Lead client meetings, requirement discussions, and project planning sessions
Collaborate with sales and business development teams on client engagements
description.requirements:
Must-Have:
Management experience - managing at least 10 employees for a minimum of 5 years, with extensive experience in recruiting and building teams
Proven track record of setting up new teams or operations from the ground up
Strong client-facing experience with excellent presentation and communication skills
At least 3 years of proven experience in one of the following: malware research, reverse engineering, penetration testing, software development
Understanding of malware research principles and the cybersecurity landscape
Experience managing client relationships and delivering technical solutions to business stakeholders
Must have a valid 
international government-issued photo ID
 (e.g., current passport, or international driver's license) for identity verification and global client interaction.
Nice-to-Have:
Experience establishing new departments or research operations within organizations
Background in scaling teams from startup or greenfield environments
Background in technical sales or business development in cybersecurity
Experience presenting to C-level executives and technical stakeholders
Experience with decompilers, debuggers, and disassemblers (e.g., JADX, JEB, LLDB, GDB, x86dbg, Ghidra, IDA Pro)
Familiarity with instrumentation frameworks like Frida or Xposed
Proficiency with HTTP debuggers, MITM tools, and network analyzers (e.g., Fiddler, HTTP Toolkit, Burp Suite, Wireshark, Little Snitch, mitmproxy)
Understanding of network communications and protocols
Familiarity with multiple programming languages (Java, C/C++, JavaScript, Python)

Continuously improve malware analysis and review processes
Conduct in-depth malware research
Write detection rules and develop automation processes for malware identification at scale

description.description:
ActiveFence’s Disinformation Research team investigates global influence operations, dis- and misinformation, and emerging online harms. We are looking for a Dis- and Misinformation Researcher to help us expand and maintain our growing disinformation database, integrate insights from external research sources, and support cross-discipline analytical efforts across the team. The role involves combining traditional research and geopolitical analysis with data-driven workflows and light automation. This is a unique opportunity for a researcher who is analytical, curious, and independent - someone who thrives at the intersection of data, geopolitics, and information integrity.
What You’ll Do
Maintain and expand ActiveFence’s disinformation database, ensuring structured and high-quality data collection from reliable sources.
Track, evaluate, and organize research and intelligence reports related to dis- and misinformation, influence operations, and emerging online threats.
Lead and collaborate on cross-disciplinary research efforts, working closely with analysts, data specialists, and subject-matter experts.
Produce clear, well-written research briefs and presentations, highlighting key insights for internal and external audiences.
Contribute to the development of data- and automation-driven research workflows to improve efficiency and scalability.
description.requirements:
Who You Are
At least BA education in Political Science, International Relations, Security Studies, or a related field.
At least two years of full-time work experience in research, analysis, or intelligence.
Possess native or near-native fluency in English, with excellent writing and storytelling skills.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of geopolitics, disinformation, and online influence operations
Organized, independent, and comfortable managing multiple projects at once.
Comfortable using digital tools and learning lightweight automation or data workflows.
Bonus Points For
Proficiency in Russian, Chinese, Spanish, French, Arabic or Farsi
Experience with open-source intelligence (OSINT) or analytical research tools.
Experience producing data-driven infographics or visual analytical outputs.

description.description:
The Field Intelligence Team (FIT) acts as the organization’s operational intelligence partner, supporting Sales and Delivery through go-to-market (GTM) research, pilots, and short-term delivery missions.
The FIT Team Lead (TL) is responsible for managing and coordinating all team activities across GTM research, Sales support, and one-off delivery projects. The TL ensures smooth task allocation, stakeholder communication, and strategic prioritization of requests while maintaining the team’s balance between supporting sales goals and contributing to delivery excellence.
Key Responsibilities
Oversee daily team workflow and manage task allocations.
Develop game plans and build research methodologies. 
Ensure final quality of GTM research desk outputs, verifying factual accuracy, comprehensive research, diversity, and actionability.
Align FIT deliverables with organizational goals and sales priorities.
Identify proactive engagement opportunities.
Provide regular updates on progress, workload, and impact metrics to leadership.

must.

must.
Strong understanding of webint/OSINT - 
must.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to deal with tight deadlines.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Demonstrated ability to balance multiple priorities and make informed decisions.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and output quality.
Fluent in languages - advantage.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking to hire a Fraud Threat Analyst to join the Intel Desk group. In this role, you will be responsible for researching, evaluating, and analyzing fraud detection mechanisms and vulnerabilities across various platforms and solutions.
You will generate strategic insights from diverse intelligence sources, conduct OSINT investigations to identify fraud risks, and monitor online platforms to detect malicious activities. You will also focus on uncovering fraud tactics, behavioral vulnerabilities, and process bypasses while delivering actionable mitigation recommendations to clients.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct investigations and identify fraud methods across web and mobile platforms (social media, forums, apps, and the darknet).
Analyze large datasets to uncover patterns and deliver actionable insights.
Monitor third-party websites and channels for malicious activities and fraud risks.
Prepare detailed reports with findings, insights, and actionable recommendations.
description.requirements:
Required Skills & Experience:
3+ years of experience in intelligence analysis, CTI, or fraud detection.
Strong understanding of OPSEC principles.
Strong knowledge of web intelligence (WEBINT) and OSINT, including social media, apps, and the dark web.
Strong analytical, communication, and reporting skills.
Proactive, creative, and quick to learn new tools and practices.
Fluent in English (additional languages are a plus).
Comfortable with sensitive content.
Advantage:
Experience in conducting red team exercises on online platforms to uncover potential abuse methods and bypass mechanisms
Experience with multiple languages.
Platform familiarity: Hands-on experience with social media, apps, and forums.
Experience with automation tools or scripting.

title: Freelancer - Biology Expert for GenAI Prompts Review

description.description:
About the Role:
We are seeking a highly qualified Biology expert, preferably with a Ph.D. in Biology or a related field, to join our team as a freelance consultant. In this role, you will contribute to an innovative project involving Generative AI (GenAI) by creating biology-related prompts and reviewing AI-generated responses. Your expertise will help ensure the accuracy, reliability, and ethical integrity of the generated content.
Key Responsibilities:
Write biology-related prompts (including trying to manipulate the model into generating dangerous CBRN-related outputs).
Evaluate AI-generated responses to biology-related prompts to assess accuracy and scientific validity.
Identify and flag content that is incorrect, harmful, misleading, or ethically concerning.
Provide constructive feedback to improve prompt design and content generation.
Stay updated with current biological research and best practices to inform evaluations.
description.requirements:
Requirements:
Advanced degree in Biology (Ph.D. preferred, but Master's degree with significant experience will be considered).
Strong background in various biological disciplines, including molecular biology, genetics, biotechnology, and related fields.
Experience with AI or machine learning projects is a plus but not required.
Excellent analytical skills with keen attention to detail.
Strong written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience in content moderation, academic review, or consulting roles.
Familiarity with ethical considerations and challenges in AI-generated content.
Knowledge of AI prompts engineering concepts and practices, including CBRN related prompts writing.

description.description:
About the position
As a Red Team Specialist focused on Generative AI Models, you will play a critical role in enhancing the security and integrity of our cutting-edge AI technologies.
Your primary responsibility will be to conduct analysis and testing of our generative AI systems, including but not limited to language models, image generation models, and any related infrastructure.
Your objective is to help clients secure their AI models and frameworks by identifying weaknesses, assessing risks, and providing clear steps for improvement.
Key Responsibilities:
Simulated Cyber Attacks: Conduct sophisticated and comprehensive simulated attacks on generative AI models and their operating environments to uncover vulnerabilities.
Vulnerability Assessment: Evaluate the security posture of AI models and infrastructure, identifying weaknesses and potential threats.
Risk Analysis: Perform thorough risk analysis to determine the impact of identified vulnerabilities and prioritize mitigation efforts.
Mitigation Strategies: Collaborate with development and security teams to develop effective strategies to mitigate identified risks and enhance model resilience.
Research and Innovation: Stay abreast of the latest trends and developments in AI security, ethical hacking, and cyber threats. Apply innovative testing methodologies to ensure cutting-edge security practices.
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed documentation of all red team activities, findings, and recommendations. Prepare and present reports to senior management and relevant stakeholders.
description.requirements:
Must-Have
Proven experience in AI vulnerabilities analysis
Strong understanding of AI technologies and their underlying architectures, especially generative models and agentic frameworks.
At Least 5 years of experience in Web Penetration testing.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
Nice-to-Have
:
Proficiency in Python or NodeJS
Advanced Certifications in offensive cybersecurity (e.g. OSWE, OSCE3, SEC542, SEC522) are highly desirable.
Familiarity with agentic frameworks and agentic development experience
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field.
Proven records for vulnerability disclosure, such as CVE

description.about activefence:
ActiveFence is the leading provider of security and safety solutions for online experiences, safeguarding more than 3 billion users, top foundation models, and the world’s largest enterprises and tech platforms every day. 
As a trusted ally to major technology firms and Fortune 500 brands that build user-generated and GenAI products, ActiveFence empowers security, AI, and policy teams with low-latency Real-Time Guardrails and a continuous Red Teaming program that pressure-tests systems with adversarial prompts and emerging threat techniques. Powered by deep threat intelligence, unmatched harmful-content detection, and coverage of 117+ languages, ActiveFence enables organizations to deliver engaging and trustworthy experiences at global scale while operating safely and responsibly across all threat landscapes.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking a driven, detail-focused professional to become a vital part of our team as a Generative AI Analyst. In this role, you'll dive into the cutting-edge of technology, meticulously analyzing various content infringements to secure the new wave of Generative AI tools. Your duties will include collaborating with experts in diverse fields such as Hate Speech, Misinformation, Intellectual Property and Copyright, Child Safety, among others.
Your tasks will involve writing adversarial; prompts to identify weaknesses in various AI models, including Large Language Models (LLMs), Text-to-Image, Text-to-Video, and beyond. You'll also oversee data management to guarantee the highest quality of outputs.
Responsibilities
:
Developing adversarial and risky prompt strategies across several areas of abuse to expose potential vulnerabilities in models.
Managing projects end-to-end, from initial planning and oversight through quality assurance to final delivery.
Handling extensive datasets across multiple languages and areas of abuse, ensuring precision and meticulous attention to detail.
Ongoing investigation into new tactics for circumventing foundational models' safety measures.
Working alongside diverse teams, engineering, product, policy, to tackle new challenges and craft forward-thinking strategies and resolutions.
Promoting a culture of knowledge exchange and continual learning within the team.
description.requirements:

Background in AI Safety
 and/or
 Responsible AI 
and/or
 AI Ethics
Familiarity with recent Generative AI models and agents is essential, though direct technical experience is not a prerequisite.
Command of English at a near-native level.
Attention to detail, organizational capabilities, and the capacity to juggle numerous tasks concurrently.
Additional Wants:
Experience with various model types (Text-to-Text, Text-to-Image) is desirable.
Prior experience with OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) will be considered an asset.
A self-starter attitude, with the energy to excel in a fast-moving and variable environment.

description.description:
At ActiveFence, we care deeply about our people and view our team as our most important asset. We strive to bring real value to the world while having fun and learning, encouraging openness and data-based decision-making. As we scale our 300-person team, we're seeking an exceptional HR Director to lead several HR domains and maintain our mission-driven culture while driving organizational excellence.
This role combines executive-level strategic thinking with hands-on work, serving as a key business partner who drives the HR agenda while building and leading our C&B, HRIS, Analytics, OD and Employee Experience domains. 
What You'll Lead
Drive multi-year talent strategy aligned with ActiveFence's business objectives 
Partner directly with the executive team on execution, organizational design and culture initiatives
Lead organizational change management during rapid scaling and transformation
Design and implement comprehensive C&B strategies, including global compensation frameworks
Partner with Finance on people-related budgeting, workforce planning, and ROI analysis
Use people analytics and data insights to identify trends, predict challenges, and drive proactive solutions
Drive employee experience initiatives that foster engagement, retention, and excellence across all functions
Drive leadership development efforts and succession planning
Identify and implement new policies, processes, technologies, and workflows that support growth and excellent employee experience
Leverage HRIS platforms and HR technology ecosystem for optimal efficiency and data accuracy

10+ years of progressive HR leadership experience
, including 5+ years in senior roles partnering with executives and building HR teams in high-growth technology companies (200-500 employees preferred)
Proven experience leading HR in organizations with a scale of 
500+ employees
 (global, multi-site preferred).
Multi-domain HR expertise
 with experience managing C&B, Employee Experience, and Organizational Development simultaneously
Startup/scale-up experience
 with demonstrated success leading organizational transformation and change management in rapid growth environments

 with ability to quickly understand company objectives, build annual talent strategies, and translate them into measurable business results
Advanced people analytics capabilities

HRIS and compensation expertise

Work Environment

description.description:
Join our fast-growing IT Support team as an IT Support Admin, working with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic environment.
Your responsibilities will include:
Maintaining and improving the company's systems infrastructure with a focus on security protocols.
Providing global service and support to end-users and partners across multiple sites.
Resolving complex and escalated support issues.
Managing user lifecycles (onboarding/offboarding) and automating related processes.
Implementing automation to enhance user experience and IT productivity.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking an R&D operations manager to improve the efficiency, operational agility, order, coordination, and innovation of multiple teams that are dedicated to malware research and review. 
This role presents an exciting opportunity to establish a new operation from the ground up, creating processes, and setting up cross-team collaboration.
This position is on-site five days a week in our Ramat Gan office. 
We encourage applications by Junior applicants
 with curiosity, hunger, and a growth mindset, who are looking for a first foothold in the tech industry and eager to gain hands-on experience.
Roles and Responsibilities
Establish operational processes, workflows, and quality standards for the new teams
Coordinate with other departments to integrate the new operation into the existing infrastructure
Support technical onboarding of new employees.
Work with AI and no-code automation tools.
Track and oversee budget spending.
Develop & maintain dashboards to enable visibility, control and support decision making.
Prepare playbooks for employees and presentation materials for the client, while improving knowledge preservation and searchability.
Improve collaboration, communication, and knowledge sharing between teams and drive the adoption of best practices.
Act as the team lead’s right hand and a go-to person for ad-hoc projects.
description.requirements:
Display accountability, autonomy, ownership, self-management and self-prioritization abilities.
Orientation toward technical, engineering, or research domains - even if not formally trained as a developer.
Quick learner of new technologies and practice areas. 
Resilient, works well under pressure, capable of adapting to changes on the fly and making sensible, responsible decisions.
Tech-savvy and an AI enthusiast.
Problem-solver with a proactive approach.
Organized and detail-oriented.
An extraordinary communicator, capable of working with everyone, including technical and non-technical individuals.
Excellent spoken and written English.
Preferred (but not mandatory) Experience:
Technical curiosity and familiarity with developer-oriented tools or environments (e.g., command-line interfaces, APIs, scripting).
Experience in project management and workflow automation.
Familiarity with Google workspace: apps (Sheets, Docs, Slides, Drive, Looker studio) and AI tools (Gemini, NotebookLM).
Recently completed a degree with honors (preferably in a technical or analytical field).
description.about activefence:
ActiveFence is the leading provider of security and safety solutions for online experiences, safeguarding more than 3 billion users, top foundation models, and the world’s largest enterprises and tech platforms every day. 
As a trusted ally to major technology firms and Fortune 500 brands that build user-generated and GenAI products, ActiveFence empowers security, AI, and policy teams with low-latency Real-Time Guardrails and a continuous Red Teaming program that pressure-tests systems with adversarial prompts and emerging threat techniques. Powered by deep threat intelligence, unmatched harmful-content detection, and coverage of 117+ languages, ActiveFence enables organizations to deliver engaging and trustworthy experiences at global scale while operating safely and responsibly across all threat landscapes.

description.description:
ActiveFence is hiring Intermediate Malware Researchers to analyze and review malware applications. Candidates should have a background in cybersecurity and software development.
The role includes training in malware analysis and detection and provides exposure to various malware threats and techniques. Researchers will combine technical and intelligence findings to reach accurate verdicts and assist in the bulk removal of malicious applications. The position requires adaptability and proactive identification of emerging malware trends.
We are seeking candidates who are willing to learn, can perform effectively under pressure, and maintain high professional standards.
description.requirements:
Must-Have:
2 years of proven experience in the industry in one of the following: malware research, reverse engineering, penetration testing, or software development
Strong understanding of Java object-oriented programming
Ability to trace execution flow through code analysis
Comprehensive knowledge of cybersecurity, networking, and programming fundamentals
Proficient English communication skills (reading and writing)
Must have a valid 
international government-issued photo ID
 (e.g., current passport, or international driver's license) for identity verification and global client interaction.
Nice-to-Have:
Computer Science degree
Proficiency in multiple programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, C/C++)
Experience with disassemblers such as IDA Pro or Ghidra
Experience with decompilers such as JADX or JEB
Familiarity with instrumentation frameworks like Frida or Xposed
Experience with HTTP debugging and network analysis tools (e.g., Fiddler, HTTP Toolkit, Burp Suite, Wireshark)
Knowledge of common malware threats and techniques

description.description:
ActiveFence is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Tech Lead to serve as the focal point for its Android Malware Research and Review efforts.
This role is centered on driving technical excellence in research, setting standards for methodology, and serving as the go-to expert for complex malware investigations. The Tech Lead will guide peers through technical reviews, ensure high-quality and accurate research outputs, and contribute hands-on expertise in dissecting and understanding sophisticated Android malware threats.
This role emphasizes thought leadership, technical depth, and the ability to elevate the overall quality of the team’s research.
description.requirements:

2 years of proven experience in malware research / reverse engineering.
Experience with static analysis using tools such as IDA Pro / Ghidra / Binary Ninja.
Experience with dynamic analysis tools such as gdb / lldb / WinDbg.
Experience with runtime instrumentation tools such as Frida.
Proficiency in one of the following programming languages: C / C++.
Experience with Assembly languages such as X86 / AArch64.
Experience with Linux systems.
Ability to provide technical leadership and peer guidance, including reviewing work, training researchers, and elevating team expertise.
Must have a valid 
international government-issued photo ID
 (e.g., current passport, or international driver's license) for identity verification and global client interaction.

Computer Science degree.
Experience in Android research.
Proficiency in Java / Python / JavaScript.
Experience with decompilers such as JADX or JEB.
Familiarity with instrumentation frameworks like Frida or Xposed.
Experience with HTTP debugging and network analysis tools (e.g., Fiddler, HTTP Toolkit, Burp Suite, Wireshark).

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking an experienced and mission-driven Organized Crime & Exploitation Team Lead to lead our technological and analytical efforts against organized criminal networks online, spanning human trafficking, sexual exploitation, illegal drugs, and other high-risk abuse areas.
In this role, you’ll manage a multidisciplinary, multi-abuse-area team of researchers and technologists who monitor, detect, and analyze organized crime and exploitation activity across online platforms. You’ll bridge intelligence and technology, developing workflows, tools, and data models that power our understanding of complex criminal ecosystems.
If you’re a proactive leader with deep expertise in threat intelligence, OSINT, and client engagement, we encourage you to apply.
Responsibilities
Lead a cross-functional team of researchers and technical analysts addressing organized crime and exploitation across multiple abuse areas, including human trafficking, sexual exploitation, and illegal drugs.
Set strategic goals, ensure high-quality analytical outputs, and manage project delivery for both internal and external stakeholders.
Serve as a client-facing lead, delivering intelligence briefings, actionable insights, and strategic recommendations to partners while representing ActiveFence as a subject-matter expert.
Guide the development of tools, automation, and data infrastructure that enhance detection, mapping, and mitigation of organized crime and exploitation networks.
Uphold rigorous research standards and ethical handling of sensitive material, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and professional resilience within the team.

, ideally with both research and technical components.

multidisciplinary and multi-abuse teams
.

online trafficking, sexual exploitation, or illegal drug trade ecosystems
.
Experience delivering 
client briefings, intelligence products, or threat assessments
 in a professional context.
Strong proficiency in 
OSINT, data analysis, automation, or threat intelligence tooling
.
Master’s degree or higher in criminology, sociology, computer science, or a related field.
Excellent communication, analytical, and project management skills.
Professional resilience and discretion when handling sensitive or graphic material.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking an experienced and detail-oriented 
Red Teaming Team Lead
 to oversee complex research and delivery efforts focused on identifying and mitigating risks in Generative AI systems. In this role, you will lead a multidisciplinary team conducting adversarial testing, risk evaluations, and data-driven analyses that strengthen AI model safety and integrity.
You will be responsible for ensuring high-quality project delivery, from methodology design and execution to client communication and final approval of deliverables. This position combines hands-on red teaming expertise with operational leadership, strategic thinking, and client-facing collaboration.
Key Responsibilities
Operational and Quality Leadership
Oversee the production of datasets, reports, and analyses related to AI safety and red teaming activities.
Review and approve deliverables to ensure they meet quality, methodological, and ethical standards.
Deliver final outputs to clients following approval and provide actionable insights that address key risks and vulnerabilities.
Offer ongoing structured feedback on the quality of deliverables and the efficiency of team workflows, driving continuous improvement.
Methodology and Research Development
Design and refine red teaming methodologies for new Responsible AI projects.
Guide the development of adversarial testing strategies that target potential weaknesses in models across text, image, and multimodal systems.
Support research initiatives aimed at identifying and mitigating emerging risks in Generative AI applications.
Client Engagement and Collaboration
Attend client meetings to address broader methodological or operational questions.
Represent the red teaming function in cross-departmental collaboration with other ActiveFence teams.
description.requirements:
Must Have
Proven background in red teaming
, AI safety research, or Responsible AI operations.
Demonstrated experience managing complex projects or teams in a technical or analytical environment.
Strong understanding of adversarial testing methods and model evaluation.
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Exceptional organizational ability and attention to detail, with experience balancing multiple priorities.
Confidence in client-facing environments, including presenting deliverables and addressing high-level questions.
Nice to Have
Advanced academic or research background in AI, computational social science, or information integrity.
Experience authoring or co-authoring publications, white papers, or reports in the fields of AI Safety, Responsible AI, or AI Ethics.
Engagement in professional or academic communities related to Responsible AI, trust and safety, or machine learning security.
Participation in industry or academic conferences.
Familiarity with developing or reviewing evaluation frameworks, benchmarking tools, or adversarial datasets for model safety testing.
Proven ability to mentor researchers and foster professional development within technical teams.
A proactive, research-driven mindset and a passion for ensuring safe, transparent, and ethical AI deployment.

description.description:
ActiveFence brings together intelligence, data, and technology experts to craft tailored solutions for some of the world’s largest tech platforms. Within this ecosystem, the 
Regional Project Manager
 serves as both an operational and strategic cornerstone.
In this role, you will lead the infrastructure, processes, and project flow for our extensive network of regional experts - thousands of professionals worldwide. As ActiveFence expands into AI evaluation, red teaming, and other GenAI-related services, you will play a pivotal role in building and scaling this new function. You will help grow our global freelancer network, strengthen operational capabilities, and expand regional coverage.
This global network includes GenAI specialists, WEBINT analysts, research vendors, and language experts, all supporting high-impact trust and safety missions across diverse languages and domains.
You’ll collaborate closely with ActiveFence teams to scope needs, design operational frameworks, and oversee execution, ensuring high-quality, scalable, and timely delivery for our Fortune 500 partners.
This position calls for strong project management skills, a can-do attitude, and the ability to connect technology, people, and processes into seamless operational systems. 
Roles and Responsibilities
Serve as the operational lead for cross-regional projects, from ideation to delivery, aligning workforce capabilities with evolving Delivery team needs.
Manage and oversee the operations and performance of 500+ freelancers and project contributors worldwide.
Collect, prioritize, and translate research, analysis, and language requests into actionable project plans for global execution.
Lead multi-stakeholder collaborations across geographies and time zones, often managing multiple, fast-paced initiatives simultaneously.
Streamline and optimize internal & external workflows through AI-driven solutions and automation tools.
Build and maintain dashboards and visualizations to track KPIs, performance metrics, and project milestones.
Conduct market and cost-efficiency research to identify new regions, vendors, and opportunities for workforce expansion, particularly within the AI evaluation and GenAI services domain.
description.requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, international relations, industrial engineering, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in project management, operations, or similar roles.
Experience working with multicultural, distributed teams across time zones.
Proven experience in leading and scaling operational processes, ideally involving the expansion of global workforce networks, vendors, or regional hubs.
Hands-on experience in freelancer operations or vendor management, ideally within freelance marketplace environments (e.g., Fiverr, Upwork, Handshake, or similar).
Technical orientation, quick learner of new technologies and practice areas. 
AI enthusiast and a savvy user of LLMs & Gen AI apps.
Proven experience in building and optimizing workflows using technological solutions (such as: Make.com, n8n, Zapier, Workato or similar tools) - a must.
A proactive problem-solver with strong ownership and accountability.
Highly organized and detail-oriented, capable of prioritizing independently in dynamic environments.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, able to engage effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent spoken and written English.
Preferred (but not mandatory) Experience:
Familiarity with BI tools, preferably Google Data Studio. 
Intelligence background.
description.about activefence:
ActiveFence is the leading tool stack for Trust & Safety teams, worldwide. By relying on ActiveFence’s end-to-end solution, Trust & Safety teams – of all sizes – can keep users safe from the widest spectrum of online harms, unwanted content, and malicious behavior, including child safety, disinformation, fraud, hate speech, terror, nudity, and more. 
Using cutting-edge AI and a team of world-class subject-matter experts to continuously collect, analyze, and contextualize data, ActiveFence ensures that in an ever-changing world, customers are always two steps ahead of bad actors. As a result, Trust & Safety teams can be proactive and provide maximum protection to users across a multitude of abuse areas, in 70+ languages. 
Backed by leading Silicon Valley investors such as CRV and Norwest, ActiveFence has raised $100M to date; employs 300 people worldwide, and has contributed to the online safety of billions of users across the globe.

title: Research Team Lead - Online Child Safety

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking a driven and compassionate leader to serve as Research Team Lead - Online Child Safety. In this vital role, you'll oversee a skilled team tackling online child exploitation, including CSAM, grooming, sextortion, trafficking and more. You’ll manage workflows, ensure exceptional delivery, and foster a culture of innovation. If you’re a motivated leader passionate about creating safer digital spaces, we encourage you to apply.
Responsibilities:
Oversee research initiatives to deliver impactful insights and address risks.
Develop data feeds and maintain databases to track harmful trends.
Mentor team members, fostering professional growth and collaboration.
Streamline workflows and implement automation for greater efficiency.
Ensure timely, accurate, and high-quality client deliverables.
Expand knowledge resources and monitor emerging threats like GenAI.
description.requirements:
Required Skills and Experience:
Minimum of 5 years' experience in the field of child safety, with a proven track record of addressing online harms such as CSAM, grooming, and trafficking.
At least 5 years' experience in research, holding a minimum of a master’s degree in criminology, sociology, or a related field; a PhD is an advantage.
At least 2 years of experience in team leadership.
Demonstrated leadership and research expertise, including managing large-scale initiatives, analyzing data, mentoring teams, and fostering collaboration.
Exceptional skills in analytical thinking, communication, and technical proficiency, with resilience to handle sensitive content and expertise in OSINT, automation, and database management.

description.description:
The Data Group is responsible for the data and algorithms which fuel ActiveFence’s ability to fight online evil at scale, ensuring trust & safety and robust AI security. With the continuous and accelerated expansion of online and GenAI threats, we are seriously scaling up our operation to deal with an ever more complex online landscape. If you love varying challenges, can move fast, and are not afraid of tackling uncharted territories with your code, you might be a good fit here. We're looking for a Senior Data Scientist to take our mission to the next level, at scale.
The team
You’ll be joining a collaborative and inclusive team of Data Scientists and ML Engineers. We love thinking together, building great products together, and having a good time together. It’s important for us that each team member grows and evolves while providing a significant impact on our product and our clients.
Primary Responsibilities
We are looking for a senior data scientist who will collaborate with fellow data scientists and developers, loves getting their hands dirty with data, code, and experimentation, and is not afraid of taking their code to production and learning from the real world.
Design and implement models and algorithms for detecting AI security vulnerabilities and exploits and harmful content, across media types whether in vision, text, audio or video. 
Play an active role in taking your models to production, affecting high throughput and low latency, while not compromising on accuracy and correctness.
Strive to constantly improve our ability to detect harmful content, in a nonstationary, adversarial environment
Participate in code reviews, design reviews,etc.
Explore new technologies and enrich other team members with your knowledge
Use best practices to write clean, maintainable code, and create a high performant, delightful experience for customers
Find the bad guys, feel proud, inspire your team to do the same
description.requirements:
Technologies:
Python, Notebook environments (Databricks, Jupyter)
ML frameworks: TensorFlow, Pytorch, Onnx, MLFlow (we use Pytorch). 
PySpark
Large Language models, LLMs, RAG systems. 
Skills and Qualifications:
5+ years of experience
 PhD/MSc in Computer Science, a related technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in either NLP or Computer Vision, preferably both. 
Experience in developing ML algorithms, from POC to production
Proven Python code development skills
Experience with large scale production systems and pipelines.
Worked with ML frameworks, algorithms and MLOps
Experience with agile practices and SaaS development.
Self learner, independent, team player with great communication skills.
You’ll be a great fit if:
You’re energetic and love data
You are proactive, enjoying taking full ownership of your deliverables, and have a can-do approach
You’re curious and always eager to learn more, no matter what level you’re at
You’re a team player with great interpersonal skills
You’re passionate about preventing online harm.
You want to learn and advance how companies use LLMs safely

description.description:
The role
Own, design, and evolve our production cloud platform (AWS), Kubernetes, and IaC (Terraform) so teams ship reliably, safely, and fast.
What you’ll do
Architect, build, and run resilient, scalable cloud infrastructure; drive AWS Well-Architected pillars (operational excellence, security, reliability, performance, cost, sustainability). 
Champion GitOps (e.g., Argo CD): declarative configs, PR-driven changes, continuous reconciliation. 
Implement and evolve CI/CD (GitHub Actions/Argo CD), secrets management, policy-as-code, and environment promotion. 
Build first-class observability (OpenTelemetry + Prometheus) across apps and infra. 
Partner with internal and external teams (engineers, data, vendors, customers) to deliver platform capabilities and service.
Lead/mentor engineers; drive Terraform standards, modules, and reviews. 
Optimize cost and efficiency (FinOps) while maintaining reliability. 
Define SLOs/SLIs and error budgets; lead incident readiness, response, and post-mortems.

Excellent communication; comfortable collaborating with external stakeholders.

description.about activefence:
ActiveFence is the leading provider of security and safety solutions for online experiences, safeguarding more than 3 billion users, top foundation models, and the world’s largest enterprises and tech platforms every day.

description.description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and technically proficient Senior Penetration Tester to join our security research division. This role is dedicated to performing advanced offensive security assessments against the biggest companies in the world
You need to be independent, attentive to details, organized, eager to learn new things, and like to research and solve problems
What you’ll do:
Lead and execute comprehensive, technically rigorous penetration tests targeting complex web applications, modern API architectures, and enterprise systems for organizations with significant global presence.
Engage in sophisticated Red Team projects, including the identification of undisclosed API endpoints, development of novel bypass techniques for established security controls, and lateral movement within target environments.
Contribute substantively to the design, development, and maintenance of proprietary internal security tools and automation frameworks to enhance the efficacy and efficiency of offensive operations.
description.requirements:
Minimum of 3 years of proven, hands-on experience in application security analysis, with a heavy emphasis on complex API penetration testing and a mastery of the OWASP Top 10 landscape.
Proficiency in developing and automating tasks using at least one language like Python, JavaScript, or GoLang.
Strong experience with static and dynamic analysis of Android and iOS applications, including hands-on experience with techniques like detours, hooking, and runtime code manipulation
Deep, hands-on knowledge of the latest tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) used in advanced penetration testing and network analysis.
Ability to author comprehensive and technically rigorous reports detailing identified vulnerabilities and research outcomes.
Nice to have:
OSCP, OSWE, eWPTXv2, CRTP, or other high-level offensive certifications.
Hands-on experience with industry-standard reversing tools like JADX, Ghidra, or IDA Pro.
Demonstrated online achievements, write-ups, or contributions on platforms such as HackTheBox, Pwn2Own, TryHackMe, Bug Bounty programs, or published security research.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Senior Violent Extremism Researcher. Here, you will play a crucial role in conducting in-depth research on hateful speech & behavior, terrorism, and other extremist activities, contributing to our mission of creating a safer and more inclusive online environment for all users. You will be responsible for managing our knowledge and ensuring the quality and standards of research delivery. Additionally, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams, analyze data, generate insights, and propose proactive strategies to address emerging issues. If you are passionate about combating violent extremism, possess excellent research and analytical skills, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.
Responsibilities:
Conduct in-depth research on violent extremism, analyzing qualitative and quantitative data to uncover actionable insights
Ensure the highest quality and standards in the research delivery to our clients, maintaining a high level of accuracy, clarity, and attention to detail
Develop research methodologies and frameworks, continuously improving processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness
Stay updated on industry trends, emerging threats, and best practices in the field of violent extremism, actively seeking opportunities for knowledge expansion
Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous learning within the department.
Review, edit, and synthesize multiple reports from other analysts into unified, client-ready outputs.

description.description:
About the position
As Threat Intelligence Analyst at ActiveFence, you will play a key role in online investigations, focusing on gathering, analyzing, and documenting intelligence from various online sources including the Vietnamese cybercrime ecosystem. Your primary objective will be to identify malicious activities, understand their origins, and analyze threat actor TTPs. Success in this role requires a technical and analytical mind, the ability to learn quickly, and a strong attention to detail. You should be comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where critical thinking and adaptability are essential.
Responsibilities
Conducting in-depth investigations on online platforms to identify malicious activities.
Analyzing TTPs such as malicious tools used by threat actors.
Monitoring websites, deep and dark web forums, messaging apps and other digital sources to detect potential threats to our customers
Using state-of-the-art internal and external tools and OSINT/WEBINT methodologies. 
Producing high-quality reports, briefings, and presentations tailored to technical and non-technical audiences.
description.requirements:
Fluency in English (Written and Verbal)
Experience in processing findings into written reports.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience in running Windows files in a VM environment and inspecting network traffic
Hands-on deep and dark web experience
Threat hunting experience.
Nice to have:
Familiarity with how malware works (Network traffic, Windows system)
Familiarity with Windows file system, Chrome extensions
Strong understanding of OPSEC principles 
Positive attitude, motivation, strong team player, and ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasked environment
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple research projects simultaneously.
Proven ability to analyze and synthesize complex cyber threat data into clear, actionable intelligence.

description.description:
ActiveFence is seeking a highly organized and client-oriented Project Manager to coordinate and oversee the delivery of threat intelligence and safety insights to our partners across multiple abuse areas, including organized crime, human trafficking, child safety, illegal drugs, counterterrorism, and hate speech.
In this role, you’ll serve as the central bridge between our clients and internal teams, ensuring that every deliverable is accurate, timely, and aligned with client needs. You’ll manage communications, coordinate internal workflows, and present intelligence findings to clients with professionalism and confidence.
Responsibilities
Own client communication and relationship management, serving as the main point of contact, from scheduling meetings and briefings to understanding client needs and translating them into actionable instructions for internal teams.
Coordinate project delivery across multiple abuse areas by bringing together researchers, analysts, product specialists, and account managers to ensure timely, high-quality outputs.
Review, prepare, and quality-assure deliverables before client submission, ensuring materials are accurate, polished, and tailored to each client’s preferred format and context.
Present findings and brief clients in online and in-person meetings, effectively communicating key insights, answering questions, and facilitating productive discussions.
Build strong relationships with client stakeholders to ensure ongoing clarity of objectives, alignment of expectations, and continuous improvement of deliverables and workflows.
description.requirements:
Required Skills and Experience
2+ years of experience in project management, client delivery, or account management, ideally within intelligence, trust & safety, or technology environments.
Proven experience working directly with clients, managing communications, presenting materials, and coordinating delivery processes.
Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and stakeholders.
Comfort and professionalism when discussing sensitive or distressing material (e.g., organized crime, exploitation, terrorism, hate speech).
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., international relations, communications, political science, criminology, or related discipline).

description.description:
As a UK Subject Matter Expert at ActiveFence, you use your internet-fluency, online resourcefulness, investigative mindset, geopolitical interest, writing proficiency, and hacker-like thinking to find rapidly emerging online narratives, social unrest, and misinformation across the UK and Ireland. 
You are a proficient writer and are comfortable with a fast paced and technical environment. You are an expert in the UK’s information ecosystems, politics, extremism, misinformation, and emerging trends. You like to work on several topics simultaneously and learn new things. Fast. 
You will be analyzing and monitoring malicious activities online while getting to their sources and distribution methods. You'll be writing, editing, and reviewing intelligence briefs, and doing research into new sources and trends. You will be the first to know about emerging political figures, narratives, and groups. 
Analyzing online activity in the UK and Ireland and providing meaningful insights. 
Researching online platforms to discover new sources and important events 
Monitoring third-party websites, forums, messaging app channels, and more to uncover malicious activities. 
Writing intelligence briefs

description.description:
What We Are Looking For
As a VP of AI Security Research
, 
you will lead, scale, and inspire multi-disciplinary teams focused on red teaming, sandboxing, adversarial testing, developing red-teaming engines, and guardrail protections for GenAI models and agentic AI systems.
In this high-profile role, you will work closely with security research, product, engineering, and compliance teams to shape and deliver the next generation of AI cybersecurity solutions, while combining strategic vision with execution to effectively safeguard LLMs and agentic AI deployments at scale.
Key Responsibilities
Building and scaling global AI security teams, while providing mentorship to senior managers and fostering an innovation-driven security culture.
Overseeing advanced adversarial evaluations for GenAI models, agentic AI, and multi-agent (A2A) systems, and delivering executive-level threat intelligence and risk assessments to inform corporate AI strategy.
Defining and implementing AI red-teaming frameworks aligned with OWASP AI Security guidelines, MITRE ATLAS, and NIST AI RMF, and operationalizing automated red-team engines to continuously stress-test models at scale.
Partnering with product and engineering to design and deploy enterprise-ready AI guardrails, including policy enforcement layers, monitoring pipelines, and anomaly detection systems – and championing secure deployment practices for GenAI (including agent orchestration via MCP and A2A workflows).
description.requirements:
Must-Have
12+ years of relevant industry experience in cybersecurity, machine learning security, or related fields (with a focus on enterprise-scale products and AI systems).
Extensive leadership experience managing and scaling security or R&D organizations, with a strong track record of building high-performance teams and driving complex projects to completion.
Deep expertise in cybersecurity and AI – proven understanding of AI threats, adversarial machine learning, LLM vulnerabilities, and AI safety frameworks (OWASP Top 10 for LLMs, NIST AI Risk Management Framework, etc.).
Strategic mindset and execution skills, with the ability to set vision and direction for AI security initiatives and also dive into technical details when needed.
Nice-to-Have
Demonstrated thought leadership in AI security by publishing research, speaking at industry events (Black Hat, DEF CON, OWASP Global AppSec), or contributing to AI security standards and open-source projects.
Experience building or deploying AI security products and tools, such as red teaming automation platforms, guardrail frameworks, or AI monitoring and anomaly detection systems.
Hands-on familiarity with agentic AI frameworks and protocols (e.g. LangChain, AutoGen, MCP, A2A) and cloud-based AI environments, showing you understand how to secure complex AI orchestration workflows.
A background in AI trust and safety or adversarial ML research, with insight into emerging threats and mitigation techniques for GenAI applications.

title: Application Development Analyst (Oracle Forms, Oracle APEX)

description.description:
Job Title: Application Development Analyst - Oracle Forms, Oracle APEX, Oracle Fusion Middleware
Location: Tallahassee, FL 
Mode: Contract 
 
BACKGROUND: 
The Department requires application development and Oracle database services to support its financial systems. This includes the development and maintenance of applications using Oracle Forms, Oracle APEX, and PL/SQL, as well as integration support for Florida PALM and FLAIR. The selected contractor will also provide expertise in Oracle Fusion Middleware to ensure secure, scalable, and high-performing application environments. Familiarity with State of Florida accounting practices and PCI compliance is essential to ensure technical alignment with state and regulatory standards. 
 
SCOPE
 
The Contractor will provide an experienced Application Development Analyst to: 
• Design, develop, and maintain Oracle-based financial applications. 
• Support integration efforts with Florida PALM and FLAIR systems. 
• Responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data integration processes to support application functionality and reporting requirements. 
• Develop and maintain PL/SQL scripts, stored procedures, and database packages. 
• Utilize Oracle Fusion Middleware for application deployment, security, and integration. 
• Ensure applications align with State of Florida accounting practices from a technical perspective. 
• Ensure applications meet data security and Payment Card Industry (PCI) compliance standards. 
• Collaborate with business and technical teams to gather requirements and implement solutions. 
• Ensure application performance, security, and compliance with Department and regulatory standards. The Contractor, through its selected candidate, must perform all tasks and complete the deliverables identified in this Statement of Work (SOW). 
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS FOR CONTRACTOR’S CANDIDATE 
 
To accomplish the work outlined above, FDACS requires an experienced Application Development Analyst with the following skills and experiences listed below. This list is not exhaustive; nor are all skills required. Technical Skills, written and verbal communication, and experiences will be the basis for evaluation of responses to the RFQ. 
Minimum Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in application development using Oracle Forms, Oracle APEX, and PL/SQL. 
• Experience with Oracle Database development, performance tuning, and troubleshooting. 
• Proficiency in Oracle Fusion Middleware components (e.g., WebLogic Server, Oracle HTTP Server). 
• Experience integrating applications with enterprise financial systems such as Florida PALM and FLAIR. 
• Knowledge of State of Florida accounting practices from a technical implementation perspective. 
• Demonstrated experience ensuring PCI compliance in application development. 
• Strong written and verbal communication skills. Preferred Experience 
• Knowledge of the Florida Accounting Information Resource (FLAIR) or Florida PALM 
• Experience with Oracle REST Data Services (ORDS). 
• Familiarity with Agile development methodologies. 
• Experience with version control systems and CI/CD pipelines. 
• Knowledge of application and data security best practice. 
• Experience working in a government or public sector environment. Educational qualifications meeting at least one of the following levels: 
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or another related field or equivalent work experience. 
• Oracle certifications (e.g., Oracle PL/SQL Developer Certified Associate, Oracle APEX Developer, Oracle Middleware certifications) are preferred. 
CONTRACTOR RESPONSIBILITIES 
The Application Development Analyst will be responsible for the following tasks: 
• Design, develop, test, and deploy Oracle Forms and APEX applications. 
• Write and maintain PL/SQL scripts, stored procedures, and triggers. 
• Support and maintain Oracle database objects and schemas. 
• Configure and manage Oracle Fusion Middleware components. 
• Provide technical support for application issues and enhancements. 
• Participate in integration efforts with Florida PALM and FLAIR systems. 
• Performing Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) operations to move data between internal systems (e.g., databases, applications, data warehouses) and external systems (e.g., third-party APIs, partner platforms, cloud services). 
• Ensuring data is accurately extracted from source systems, transformed to meet business and technical specifications, and loaded into appropriate target environments. 
• Collaborating with stakeholders to define data mapping, transformation rules, and validation requirements. 
• Implementing data quality checks and error handling mechanisms to ensure integrity and reliability of data flows. 
• Supporting scheduled and on-demand ETL processes as required by business operations or project timelines. 
• Coach, mentor, and train OATS team members and other FDACS staff. 
• Create and maintain technical documentation and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). 
• Attend and participate in project meetings and provide regular status updates. 
• Submit weekly project reports and time sheets. 
DELIVERABLES 
 
The Contractor must perform the tasks listed under Contractor Responsibilities, as requested by the Department. The Contractor must invoice these tasks in one-hour increments and provide evidence of their performance by submitting applicable type of documentation detailed in the list below. Complete and submit all documents in a format compatible with Microsoft Office 2016 or newer to the Department’s Contract Manager as specified in the timeframe provided below. 
a. Status Report:
 Detail the status and level of service provided to Department staff, and the projected completion date for each assigned task. Submit this report weekly. 
b. Time Reports:
 Detail tasks worked on each day, and the hours spent on each task. Submit this report monthly. 
c. Technical Documentation: 
Submit completed technical documentation, that evidences all work performed complies with the OATS policies, procedures, and technical standards provided by the Department’s Contract Manager. Information contained in the technical documentation must also facilitate the transfer of knowledge to Department staff that is necessary to maintain the system(s). Technical documentation must be satisfactorily completed within the response time specified by the Department’s Contract Manager. Technical documentation includes but is not limited to: a. Detailed assessment report of the Department’s Oracle-based financial applications, identifying technical deficiencies, security risks, performance bottlenecks, and opportunities for enhancement or modernization. b. Comprehensive plan to refactor or enhance legacy Oracle Forms and APEX applications, including recommendations for improved maintainability, performance, and compliance with State of Florida accounting practices and PCI standards. c. Integration roadmap outlining the steps required to support and enhance system interfaces with Florida PALM and FLAIR, including data mapping, transformation logic, and scheduling of integration points. 
d. 
Conduct technical knowledge transfer sessions for Department staff on newly developed or enhanced Oracle applications, PL/SQL packages, and integration workflows, ensuring operational readiness and long-term maintainability. 
e.
 Produce detailed technical documentation for each application or integration developed or modified, including: 
• Application architecture diagrams 
• PL/SQL logic and data flow documentation
• Oracle APEX page/component structure 
• Fusion Middleware deployment configurations 
• Security and compliance considerations (including PCI) 
f. Operations Manuals:
 Prepare and submit any other documentation required by the Department’s Contract Manager 
g. Performance Measures:
 The Contractor must provide the deliverables and required documentation as outlined above. 
h. Acceptance of Deliverables: 
 The Contractor must submit the required documentation evidencing the deliverables listed above to the Department’s Contract Manager for review and approval. 
Failure to accept a deliverable within ten (10) Business Days constitutes non-acceptance by the Department unless stated otherwise by the Department’s Contract Manager in writing. If subsequent work that is the responsibility of the Contractor invalidates some or all of the contents of a deliverable, the Department reserves the right to require the Contractor to revise deliverables previously approved at no additional cost to the Department, or to reject current deliverables based on inconsistency with the SOW. 
i. Facilities and Equipment: 
 The Contractor will perform the tasks and responsibilities referenced herein on-site, in the Department’s Tallahassee office. The Department will facilitate the Contractor’s on-site performance by providing items including, but not necessarily limited to: working facilities, development and testing environments, equipment 3 and licenses, access to the Department’s network, and internet connectivity. Telework may be approved at the discretion of the Contract Manager.

description.description:
Job Title: AWS Cloud Architect (Application Modernization) 
Experience: 10+ years
Location: Onsite – New Jersey
Mode: Contract 
Domain: Telecom Domain Mandatory 
 
Overview
 We are seeking an experienced AWS Cloud Architect to lead the modernization of legacy applications into a cloud-native architecture on AWS. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in AWS services, application migration strategies, and modernization frameworks, ensuring secure, scalable, and cost-optimized solutions. This role requires strong architectural leadership, hands-on technical skills, and the ability to collaborate across multiple teams to deliver a successful transformation.
 
Technical Skills Required 
Strong expertise in AWS services: EC2, ECS/EKS, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, S3, CloudFront, API Gateway, CloudWatch
Experience designing microservices, serverless architectures, and containerized workloads. 
Proven experience in modernizing monolithic applications to cloud-native architectures. 
Hands-on experience with Terraform, CloudFormation, and CI/CD pipelines (AWS CodePipeline, Jenkins, GitHub Actions). 
Strong knowledge of IAM, VPC, security groups, encryption, and compliance frameworks.
 
Certification: 
AWS certificate is mandatory ( at least associate level if not professional)
 
Key Responsibilities
·       Define cloud architecture strategy for modernizing legacy applications to AWS. 
·       Design end-to-end AWS solutions leveraging services such as EC2, ECS/EKS, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, API Gateway, and S3.
·       Develop migration roadmaps including rehosting, replat forming, and refactoring approaches. 
·       Apply AWS Well-Architected Framework principles for security, reliability, performance, and cost optimization. 
·       Collaborate with DevOps teams to implement CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform/CloudFormation. 
·       Ensure compliance with security best practices, including IAM policies, VPC design, and encryption standards. 
·       Conduct architecture reviews, performance tuning, and cost optimization for cloud workloads.

Principal Engineer
We are seeking a highly experienced and motivated Mgr AWS Solutions Architect/Engineer with strong expertise in ETRM platforms, specifically OpenLink Endur, to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will combine deep cloud architecture knowledge with hands-on experience in designing, deploying, and managing energy trading solutions in AWS. You will play a key role in modernizing ETRM systems, leading cloud migrations, and implementing best practices around scalability, performance, and cost-efficiency.
· 7+ years of experience in IT infrastructure and cloud architecture, with at least 3+ years in AWS.
· 2+ years of experience with OpenLink Endur, including configuration, customization, and integration.
· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
· Experience deploying and operating Endur components in cloud or hybrid environments.
· Strong knowledge of AWS services: EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation, etc.
· Proficiency in Terraform, Ansible, Python, Groovy, Shell scripting, and Kubernetes.
· Hands-on experience integrating ETRM platforms with energy exchanges and market data providers.
· Strong understanding of networking, IAM, data security, and compliance in cloud environments.
· Familiarity with trade capture, risk, settlements, and reporting modules in ETRM systems.
· Strong experience in building CICD using the DevSecOps automation

description.description:
Job Description – Azure/.NET Production Support Engineer
Primary Role
Responsible for triage, issue resolution, and minor configuration/code fixes to support mission-critical applications in a 24x7 production support model. This is a customer-facing role that requires direct interaction with clients, business users, and stakeholders to ensure timely resolution of issues and continuous service availability.
Key Responsibilities
· Provide L1/L2 production support for Azure-based enterprise applications.
· Triage and resolve production issues across Azure services (Function Apps, Storage Accounts, Service Bus, Application Insights, Synapse, Cosmos DB).
· Handle Dead Letter Queues (DLQs), perform message replay in Service Bus, and troubleshoot message delivery issues.
· Manage DevOps pipeline issues, re-run failed deployments, and ensure CI/CD pipeline health.
· Troubleshoot and resolve Power BI gateway/configuration errors.
· Perform root cause analysis (RCA), prepare detailed documentation, and drive permanent fixes.
· Write queries for Cosmos DB and Synapse Data Warehouse; troubleshoot pipeline failures using KSQL.
· Make minor configuration/code changes in .NET/C# under established guidelines.
· Ensure compliance with ITIL processes, including incident, problem, and change management.
· Collaborate closely with clients and internal teams to ensure high-quality support delivery.
Key Skills & Competencies
· Technical Expertise:
o Hands-on experience with Azure services (Function Apps, Storage Accounts, Service Bus, Application Insights, Synapse, Cosmos DB).
o Strong knowledge of .NET / C# development for configuration updates and minor fixes.
o Experience with ServiceNow or similar ITSM tools.
o Familiarity with monitoring tools for proactive issue detection.
· Production Support:
o Prior experience supporting mission-critical applications in a 24x7 model.
o Strong troubleshooting skills with ability to quickly identify root cause and apply fixes.
· Communication & Customer Engagement:
o Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear stakeholder updates and RCA documentation.
o Strong interpersonal skills with proven experience in customer-facing roles.
o Ability to manage client expectations and provide professional, timely updates during critical incidents.
· Domain & Process Knowledge:
o Awareness of ITIL framework and structured support processes.
o Experience in the Energy sector is a strong plus.
Tools & Technologies
· Azure Services: Function Apps, Storage Accounts, Service Bus, Application Insights, Synapse, Cosmos DB
· Languages: .NET, C#
· ITSM: ServiceNow
· Reporting & Monitoring: Power BI, Azure Monitor, App Insights
Additional Requirements
· Must be visa-ready to work onsite in the USA at client locations.
· Willingness to work in shifts supporting 24x7 coverage.
· Strong ability to collaborate in global delivery environments (onshore/offshore model).
