title: Change Management Consultant - PeopleSoft Statewide Systems

description.description:
This role is designed for a PeopleSoft Change Management Consultant with expertise in organizational change management (OCM) and statewide PeopleSoft implementations. The consultant will focus on ensuring smooth adoption of the Florida PALM (Planning, Accounting, and Ledger Management) system by developing and executing change management strategies that address the needs of stakeholders at all levels.
Key Responsibilities
Change Management Strategy Development:
Develop and execute a comprehensive change management strategy tailored to the Florida PALM project.
Conduct stakeholder assessments to identify key groups impacted by the transition to PeopleSoft.
Create a change impact analysis to assess organizational readiness and identify potential risks or resistance.
Communication and Engagement:
Design and implement communication plans to inform stakeholders about project goals, timelines, and benefits.
Develop messaging strategies to foster buy-in from state agencies and end-users.
Facilitate workshops, focus groups, and meetings to gather feedback and address concerns.
Training and Knowledge Transfer:
Design training programs and materials to prepare users for new PeopleSoft functionalities.
Deliver training sessions or coordinate with training teams to ensure effective knowledge transfer.
Provide ongoing support to end-users during the implementation process.
Change Adoption and Monitoring:
Develop metrics to measure change adoption, user engagement, and overall project success.
Monitor progress against change management goals and adjust strategies as needed.
Ensure alignment between technical implementation teams and business stakeholders.
Collaboration with Project Teams:
Work closely with functional, technical, and project management teams to align change management efforts with system implementation activities.
Act as a liaison between stakeholders, leadership, and the PeopleSoft development team.
Provide input on project timelines to ensure adequate time for change management activities.
description.requirements:
Required Qualifications
Proven experience in organizational change management for large-scale ERP implementations, particularly PeopleSoft Financials or HCM.
Familiarity with statewide systems like FLAIR or similar public sector financial systems.
Strong knowledge of change management methodologies such as Prosci ADKAR or Kotter’s Change Model.
Experience conducting stakeholder analysis, impact assessments, and readiness evaluations.
Proficiency in creating communication plans, training materials, and adoption metrics.
Preferred Skills
Experience with hybrid ERP solutions integrating legacy systems into modern platforms like Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).
Strong understanding of PeopleSoft modules such as General Ledger (GL), Accounts Payable (AP), or Commitment Control (KK).
Excellent interpersonal skills to manage resistance and foster collaboration across diverse stakeholder groups.
Knowledge of Florida PALM’s objectives and phased implementation approach.
Educational Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Organizational Development, Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field.
Certifications such as Prosci Change Management Practitioner or Certified Change Management Professional (CCMP) are highly desirable.

title: Database Migration Engineer – MSSQL to PostgreSQL (AWS RDS)

description.description:
🔥 IMPORTANT – Must Have (Non-Negotiable)
Please apply ONLY if you meet ALL the following criteria:
Hands-on experience migrating MSSQL databases to PostgreSQL
 (not just development)
Strong T-SQL to PL/pgSQL conversion experience
 (20K+ stored procedures, functions, triggers)
Deep experience with AWS SCT and AWS DMS in real migration projects
Advanced MSSQL and PostgreSQL performance tuning expertise
Experience validating compatibility with .NET Core microservices (API-level data logic)
Experience optimizing or rewriting procedures for performance + business logic accuracy
This is NOT a Big Data/ETL/Data Engineer role. No Spark, Databricks, or Snowflake profiles.
Job Summary
We are looking for a 
specialized Database Migration Engineer
 to lead a large-scale migration of 
20,000+ MSSQL stored procedures
 to 
AWS RDS for PostgreSQL
.
The role focuses on 
database migration, stored procedure conversion, SQL optimization
, and ensuring complete alignment with 
.NET Core microservices
 that depend on this logic.
This role requires someone who has done 
heavy stored procedure migrations
, not ETL/data pipelines.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze 
complex MSSQL stored procedures
, functions, triggers, views.
Convert 
T-SQL to PL/pgSQL
 including:
Data type mapping
Control flow
Cursors
Temporary tables
Set-based logic
Error handling
Rewrite, refactor, and optimize SQL logic during migration.
Identify redundant or obsolete SPs and suggest consolidation or removal.
Use 
AWS SCT
 for assessment and conversion templates.
Use 
AWS DMS
 for continuous data migration/replication.
Validate compatibility with 
.NET Core microservices
 consuming the database APIs.
Performance tune PostgreSQL (indexes, partitions, execution plans).
Work with DevOps on 
RDS configuration, backups, scaling, security
.
Build automation scripts (Python/Shell) for migration workflows.
Create migration dashboards, logs, and validation scripts.
description.requirements:
Required Technical Skills
MSSQL
Expert in T-SQL programming
Complex SPs, triggers, views, indexing
Query & execution plan optimization
PostgreSQL
Strong PL/pgSQL experience
Function rewriting, indexing, partitioning
Performance tuning, query refactoring
AWS
AWS RDS for PostgreSQL (must)
AWS Schema Conversion Tool – SCT (must)
AWS Database Migration Service – DMS (must)
CloudWatch monitoring
Tools & Scripting
Python / Shell / PowerShell for automation
Git/Bitbucket for versioning
Preferred Qualifications
AWS Certification – Data Engineer / Database Specialty
Experience with EF Core, Dapper, or .NET Core data layer
Knowledge of schema design, normalization, API-driven data models
Experience with Terraform/CloudFormation
Soft Skills
Extremely strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to optimize and refactor very complex SQL logic
Strong communication skills to work with application, DevOps, and cloud teams
High ownership and attention to detail

description.description:
Job Summary:
Manager QE to drive test automation and quality strategy for a personalization project in the retail domain. The role requires strong automation skills, experience with data-driven testing, and the ability to work with large datasets in the background. Backend testing experience is preferable.
Key Responsibilities:
· Lead test automation strategy for personalization workflows. Responsible for entire QE for the program. Has to work with offshore and Clients.
· Develop and maintain automated test suites for APIs, UI, and data validation.
· Ensure data integrity and validation in personalization models.
· Collaborate with data engineers, developers, and product teams to define quality standards.
· Exposure around performance and scalability tests for high-volume data scenarios.
· Drive continuous testing and CI/CD pipeline integration.
Required Skills & Experience:
· 7+ years in Quality Engineering with expertise in test automation.
· Experience in retail/e-commerce domain, preferably with personalization.
· Strong skills in Selenium, Cypress or similar automation tools.
· API testing experience using Postman, Rest Assured, or similar frameworks.
· Hands-on experience with SQL, data validation, and working with large datasets.
· Familiarity with Python, Java, or JavaScript for automation scripting.
· Experience in Big Data, Spark, or cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) is a plus. One of this.
· Strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

description.description:
About the Role
We’re looking for a certified Scrum Master with hands-on experience in 
Workday Advanced Compensation
. This role is responsible for guiding Agile ceremonies, driving sprint delivery, and ensuring our Workday Compensation initiatives stay on track. You’ll serve as a bridge between business stakeholders, HR, and technical teams to deliver enhancements, integrations, and configurations aligned with organizational goals.
Key Responsibilities
Facilitate all Scrum ceremonies (stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, reviews).
Coach and guide the team in Agile best practices.
Manage sprint planning, backlog grooming, and ensure work is well-defined and prioritized.
Partner with HR and business stakeholders to gather requirements related to Workday Advanced Compensation.
Ensure timely delivery of Workday configuration, testing, and deployment.
Remove impediments and support the team in resolving roadblocks.
Track metrics and provide transparency into sprint progress and outcomes.
Collaborate with Workday functional and technical teams to implement enhancements.
Remote Position
No 3rd Party

description.description:
Sansar Tec LLC is seeking a skilled and innovative Senior Conversational Designer to lead the design and development of cutting-edge conversational interfaces. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of user experience principles, natural language processing, and conversational AI. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to create engaging and intuitive dialogue flows that enhance user interaction with our products.
Responsibilities:
Lead the design and implementation of conversational interfaces for various platforms, ensuring a seamless user experience.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to define conversational strategies and user flows.
Conduct user research and usability testing to gather feedback and iterate on conversational designs.
Create and maintain documentation for conversation design guidelines, best practices, and style guides.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies related to conversational AI and design.

Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Linguistics, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in conversational design or UX design with a focus on chatbots and voice interfaces.
Proven experience in designing natural language interactions and dialogue systems.
Strong portfolio showcasing your conversational design projects and thought processes.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate design concepts to diverse audiences.

Sansar Tec LLC is seeking a highly skilled Senior Python Developer with a passion for developing robust and scalable applications. The ideal candidate will possess strong programming skills, a deep understanding of Python programming, and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions. Join our dynamic team to drive innovation and contribute to exciting projects that make a difference.

Design, develop, and maintain high-quality Python applications to meet business needs.

Think of this as a hybrid role where you’re part lead developer, part process analyst, and part subject-matter expert. description.description:
This role is designed for a PeopleSoft Techno-Functional Consultant with expertise in both technical and functional aspects of PeopleSoft systems, specifically for the Florida PALM (Planning, Accounting, and Ledger Management) project. The consultant will play a key role in implementing, enhancing, and supporting PeopleSoft applications while bridging the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities
Requirements Gathering and Analysis:
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements.
Conduct fit-gap analysis to identify system enhancements or customizations needed for Florida PALM.
Translate functional requirements into technical specifications.
System Configuration and Customization:
Configure PeopleSoft modules such as General Ledger (GL), Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), Payroll, or Commitment Control (KK) to meet business needs.
Develop and modify technical components using PeopleTools, including Application Designer, Application Engine, Component Interfaces, and PeopleCode.
Customize delivered functionalities while minimizing deviations from standard PeopleSoft features.
Integration and Data Conversion:
Design and implement integrations between PeopleSoft systems and external applications using Integration Broker or web services.
Support data conversion processes from legacy systems like FLAIR to PeopleSoft.
Ensure seamless data flow between HCM and FSCM modules, including payroll-to-GL interfaces.
Testing and Troubleshooting:
Develop test plans and scripts for unit testing, system integration testing (SIT), and user acceptance testing (UAT).
Troubleshoot issues during implementation phases and provide timely resolutions.
Validate data accuracy during system migrations or upgrades.
End-User Support and Training:
Provide functional support to end-users by addressing system issues or queries.
Develop user manuals, training materials, and deliver training sessions on new functionalities or processes.
Act as a liaison between technical teams and business users to ensure alignment.
Project Management Support:
Assist in project planning, task prioritization, and timeline management.
Provide regular updates on project progress to leadership teams.
Identify risks related to technical implementations and propose mitigation strategies.
description.requirements:
Required Qualifications
Extensive experience with PeopleSoft HCM/Financials version 9.2 in both functional (e.g., GL, AP, AR) and technical areas (e.g., Application Engine, PeopleCode).
Hands-on experience in full lifecycle implementations of statewide PeopleSoft projects.
Strong knowledge of integration tools like Integration Broker and data conversion methodologies.
Proficiency in SQL, SQR, nVision reporting, PS Query, and other reporting tools.
Familiarity with Florida’s financial systems such as FLAIR is highly desirable.
Preferred Skills
Experience with hybrid ERP solutions integrating legacy systems into modern platforms like Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).
Knowledge of security configurations for enterprise-level ERP systems.
Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Experience working in Agile or Waterfall project methodologies.
Educational Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.
Certifications in PeopleSoft applications or Oracle technologies are preferred.

description.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Workday Banking and Settlement Consultant to lead the automation and enhancement of our global banking integrations. This role will focus on automating MT940 feeds, converting MT940 to CamT.053, enhancing BAI2 rules, and optimizing the end-to-end Banking and Settlement process within Workday.
Key Responsibilities
Automate ingestion of MT940 and BAI2 bank statement files into Workday.
Design and implement MT940 to CamT.053 conversion logic.
Enhance BAI2 rule sets for accurate reconciliation and reporting.
Collaborate with Treasury, Finance, and Integration teams to streamline banking workflows and reporting.
Configure and support Workday integrations (MFT, connectors, etc.).
Build Workday reports to monitor integration health and exceptions.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to bank file processing and settlement logic.
Support ISO 20022 (CamT) enablement and related compliance initiatives.
No 3rd party

Required Qualifications
5+ years of Workday Financials experience, with 2+ years in Banking and Settlement.
Strong hands-on experience with MT940, CamT.053, and BAI2 formats.
Proven ability to configure Workday integrations and reconciliation rules.
Deep understanding of financial operations: A/P, GL, cash management.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
________________________________________
Preferred Qualifications
Workday Financials / HR certifications
Experience with ISO 20022 and global banking standards.
Familiarity with Workday’s MT Messaging Configuration and Integration Maps.
Exposure to Workday Supplier and Customer modules.
Experience working in a global, matrixed environment.
Expertise in Workday Prism Pipelines development.
Extensive hands-on experience with Prism Transformations.
Good understanding of Data Change Tasks (DCTs).
Knowledge of Workday Prism Analytics

description.description:
Sansar Tec LLC is seeking a skilled Senior Workday Financials Consultant to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess extensive knowledge and experience in Workday Financials implementation and optimization, providing expert guidance to our clients in streamlining their financial processes. You will play a crucial role in enhancing financial operations, ensuring compliance, and driving efficiency through innovative solutions tailored to meet diverse client needs.
Responsibilities:
Lead the implementation and configuration of Workday Financials modules for various clients.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate them into functional specifications.
Provide expert guidance on financial processes, best practices, and Workday Financials functionalities.
Conduct system testing, user training, and post-implementation support to ensure system integrity.
Analyze and report on financial data, identifying trends and areas for improvement.
Stay updated with Workday Financials releases and enhancements to provide ongoing value to clients.

A minimum of 5 years of experience in Workday Financials consulting and implementation.
Workday Financials Certification (Required)
Strong understanding of financial processes, accounting principles, and regulatory compliance.
Proven experience in managing client relationships and delivering high-quality consulting services.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a results-driven mindset.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.

description.description:
The Workday Advanced Compensation Consultant is responsible for the implementation, configuration, and optimization of Workday’s Advanced Compensation module. This role works closely with clients to design and deliver compensation solutions that support business objectives, ensure compliance, and drive employee engagement.
Key Responsibilities
Lead or support the implementation of Workday Advanced Compensation, including requirements gathering, system configuration, testing, and deployment.
Analyze client compensation strategies and processes to identify opportunities for improvement and recommend best practices.
Configure and customize compensation plans, merit cycles, bonus programs, and related processes within Workday.
Ensure compensation solutions are aligned with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Collaborate with HR and business leaders to design compensation structures that support talent management and business goals.
Conduct system testing, troubleshoot issues, and implement enhancements to ensure accuracy and effectiveness.
Provide training and documentation to end users and administrators.
Stay up to date with Workday releases and new features related to compensation.
Support clients with ongoing maintenance, updates, and process improvements after implementation.
Build and maintain strong client relationships through clear communication and expert guidance.
description.requirements:

Advanced configuration and implementation experience with Workday Advanced Compensation (merit, bonus, stock plans) is Mandatory
Strong understanding of Workday HCM, Core Compensation, and related modules (Benefits, Talent, Recruiting, Reporting
Proficiency in data management, including data conversion, validation, and integration tools (iLoads, EIB, XML)
Experience with Workday business process configuration, security administration, and reporting
Familiarity with the full Workday implementation lifecycle, including requirements gathering, testing (UAT), and production support

Workday Advanced Compensation

description.description:

Should bring in functional skills, ability to keep the business context in sight, and roll-up-your-sleeves work ethic to a team with positive, can-do attitude, a collaborative culture, and a passion for helping our clients to be successful.
 
Responsibilities:
Onshore lead who leads Workday Professional Services Automation & Financials workstream for the assigned set of accounts (Partner certification is mandatory).
Apply and execute various AMS and\or Implementation methodologies\activities in these Workday FINS\PSA engagements

Work with clients to identify/resolve all issues that could impact project scope and/or timeframe.
Comfortable with leading multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks effectively, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

: Must hold relevant Workday Financials and Professional Services Automation certifications specific to the job scope (e.g., Partner certification in Financials and PSA).

Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in Workday Financials and PSA functional roles, particularly in post-production/AMS environments.
Proven experience leading Workday Financials/PSA workstreams in a managed services or global delivery model.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to issue resolution.

description.description:
The Workday HCM Consultant is responsible for implementing, configuring, and optimizing Workday Human Capital Management (HCM) solutions. This role works directly with clients to understand their HR needs and deliver effective Workday solutions that improve HR operations and maximize the value of the Workday platform.
Key Responsibilities
Lead or support the implementation of Workday HCM modules, such as Core HCM, Compensation, Benefits, Talent, Recruiting, Time Tracking, and Absence.
Gather, analyze, and document business requirements from client stakeholders and translate them into system configurations.
Configure and customize Workday HCM modules to fit client-specific HR processes and compliance requirements.
Conduct design workshops, working sessions, and user training to ensure successful system adoption.
Develop, test, and deploy business processes, security roles, reports, dashboards, and integrations within Workday HCM.
Advise clients on best practices and process improvements to drive efficiency and compliance.
Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and system updates after implementation, including managing new Workday releases and features.
Prepare and deliver documentation, presentations, and status reports to project managers and client teams.
Mentor junior consultants and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.
At least 5 years of hands-on experience with Workday HCM, including configuration and implementation of multiple modules.
Workday Certified Professional
 credential is required.
Workday HCM functional
 certification is required.
Strong understanding of HR processes and best practices.
Experience with Workday reporting, analytics, and business process design.
Excellent communication and client management skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Workday integrations and data migration.
Prior consulting experience in a client-facing role.
Advanced skills in HR analytics and dashboard creation.
Experience with global HR operations and regulatory compliance.

description.description:
As a Workday Payroll Principal Consultant, you will guide clients through the transformation, implementation, and operation phases of a Workday Payroll implementation. Additionally, you must have a technical aptitude and be capable of configuring the product to meet the business requirements and design specifications. The Workday Payroll Principal Consultant will “bridge the gap” between the business and technical teams by solving complex Workday intersystem problems
Responsibilities:
Execute the day-to-day activities of Workday integrations/Extend support for a variety of customer contracts in roles that may include staff augmentation, ad-hoc support, and project delivery.
Track issues and risks, communicate status and escalate concerns to project management.
Facilitate knowledge transfer and educate clients on developing and operating interfaces to and from a SaaS platform.
Provide subject matter expertise on Workday best practices.
Evaluate, communicate, and coordinate the technical impacts of integration configuration decisions.
Become a Workday Integrations expert with deep knowledge of core functionality, while building an understanding of Financials, Learning, Compensation, Payroll, Benefits, and Talent modules, as well as future product direction.
Mentor other consultants: actively share product knowledge with others to grow our practice.
Work directly with key business and IT stakeholders to establish requirements, consider design alternatives, facilitate discussions, and ultimately configure, test and deploy integrations solutions.
description.requirements:
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience implementing and supporting Workday Payroll, including configuration and optimization.
In-depth knowledge of payroll processes, tax regulations, and compliance requirements.
Proficiency with Workday configuration tools and reporting (e.g., EIB, Advanced Report Writer, Business Process Framework).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to design solutions for complex payroll requirements.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience collaborating across teams and with clients.
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Preferred Qualifications
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to design solutions for complex payroll requirements.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience collaborating across teams and with clients.
Certifications
Workday Certified Professional credential (mandatory).
Workday Payroll functional certification (mandatory).

description.description:
Workday Security Consultant will be focused on optimal security design and configuration of the Workday Finance ERP and Workday HRIS platforms. They will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining a secure Workday environment, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Key Responsibilities:
Designing and Implementing Security Frameworks: Defining and implementing security models across various Workday modules including Workday Financial Management, HCM, Payroll, Time Tracking, and Workday Adaptive Planning.
Security Configuration: Performing hands-on configuration of Workday security settings, including security groups and user access management.
Access Control and User Provisioning: Collaborating with different teams to define and refine access controls and user provisioning processes. Organize for and conduct User Access Reviews (UAR) two times a year.
Security Architecture Reviews: Supporting reviews of the Workday security architecture and providing recommendations for improvement.
Compliance and Audits: Ensuring Workday security aligns with compliance standards like SOX and GDPR, and conducting audits and risk assessments.
Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution: Diagnosing and resolving security-related issues within the Workday system.
Staying Updated: Keeping up-to-date with Workday releases, enhancements, and integrations, ensuring all related security aspects are considered.
Documentation: Maintaining comprehensive documentation of security architecture, policies, and procedures.
description.requirements:
Required Qualifications
3-5 years of experience with Workday Security.
Workday Security Expertise: In-depth knowledge of Workday security frameworks, including domain and business process security policies, security groups, and user access management.
Security Architecture and Design: Proven experience in designing and implementing security solutions, including intersection security, new security roles and other configurations within Workday.
Compliance Knowledge: Understanding of security control frameworks and threat modeling techniques. Prior experience supporting SOX audits, UAR and GDPR initiatives.
Risk Management: Strong understanding of risk management and mitigation strategies.
Troubleshooting and Problem Solving: Ability to troubleshoot and resolve security-related issues.
Collaboration: Strong ability to work with cross-functional teams, including HR, cybersecurity, and technology services
Preferred Qualifications
Workday HCM and/or Financials Certifications
No Third Party, please

description.description:
Accelerated Digital Media is a digital marketing agency with a focus on performance media management across paid search, paid social, and programmatic. Our culture prioritizes our team and values high standards. We welcome fresh perspectives, champion collaboration, and cultivate individual accountability to meet our ambitious growth objectives. Specializing in direct-to-consumer brands, we excel in healthcare, specifically digital health, and e-commerce, including a range of consumer products.
For a view of our current client base, visit 
our clients page
.
Job Overview:
We’re seeking a highly motivated and experienced  Client Strategy Manager, Paid Media to join our dynamic team. The Client Strategy Manager will ensure our clients achieve their desired outcomes through the effective use of ADM's services. 
This role requires a deep understanding of 
paid digital media, strong analytical skills, and building and maintaining long-term client relationships.
Responsibilities:
Client Relationship Management:
 Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and key stakeholders to ensure satisfaction, retention, and strategic alignment.
Strategic Planning:
 Understand client goals and develop strategies to achieve them, ensuring alignment with ADM's capabilities.
Performance Reviews:
 Conduct regular reviews and provide actionable insights to clients and internal teams.
Internal Coordination:
 Work with internal teams to deliver comprehensive, full-funnel media strategies and campaigns.
Campaign Monitoring:
 Monitor and analyze campaign performance, providing recommendations for optimization.
Client Onboarding:
 Facilitate the onboarding of new clients, ensuring a smooth transition and setup.
Issue Resolution:
 Handle client inquiries and issues, providing timely and effective solutions.
Sales Collaboration:
 Collaborate with sales and account teams to identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling ADM services.
Documentation & Insights Management:
 Maintain detailed records of client interactions and performance metrics in CRM systems.
description.requirements:
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in client strategy management or account management
3+ years in a Performance Media Agency
Proven track record of managing and optimizing digital media campaigns.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to drive decisions.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms, including CRM systems.
Ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skills.
This role is required to be based in the US or Canada.
description.benefits:
Why Join ADM:
We offer a competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
We invest in our team by empowering new ideas and providing opportunities for continuous professional development 
We foster an open, supportive, and productive culture that extends into the homes of our remote workers around the continent.
We work with innovative & transformative digital health brands as well as the fastest-growing e-commerce companies
Up to 90% company sponsorship for health, dental, and vision
401K with employer match program 
Generous PTO for all employees
Total Compensation for this role is up to $90,000
How to Apply:
If you're ready to take your Paid Media career to new heights and be part of a dynamic team that's driving digital success, we invite you to apply! Join us in shaping the future of digital marketing and be a key player in our success at Accelerated Digital Media.
Accelerated Digital Media is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

description.description:
Accelerated Digital Media is a  digital marketing agency with a focus on performance media management across paid search and paid social channels. Our culture prioritizes our team and values high standards. We welcome fresh perspectives, champion collaboration, and cultivate individual accountability to meet our ambitious growth objectives. Specializing in direct-to-consumer brands, we excel in healthcare, specifically digital health, and e-commerce which includes a range of consumer products.
Job Summary: 
As a Media Strategist, you will play a crucial role in planning and executing paid media campaigns to achieve our innovative & transformative digital health and e-commerce clients' marketing goals. You will be responsible for developing campaign strategies, managing budgets, optimizing performance, and staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices. description.description:
Help members overcome financial challenges with compassion and integrity.
Join First Alliance Credit Union as a 
Remote Bilingual (Spanish) Member Solutions Advisor
—a people-first collections role focused on resolving delinquency, supporting members, and protecting their financial well-being.
Empathetic. Persistent. Purpose-Driven. The Heart of Our Collections Team.
At First Alliance Credit Union, we believe that every member deserves understanding and support, especially when life gets tough. Our Member Solutions Advisors combine financial know-how with genuine compassion to help members overcome challenges and get back on track.
This role is part of our 
Member Solutions (Collections)
 team, where you’ll work to resolve delinquent accounts through proactive communication, education, and care. You’ll protect both the member’s financial health and the credit union’s integrity all while living our mission of 
Financial Well-Being for All.
This position is
 
remote, but connection matters to us. You’ll travel to 
Minnesota for a two-week onboarding and training
, with travel, lodging, and meals covered. You’ll also join us 
once a year in February
 for our all-staff training day/week, a celebration of learning, collaboration, and culture.
﻿
What You’ll Do
Connect with Members:
 Reach out to members with delinquent or negative accounts to understand their situation and find solutions that work — from payment plans to hardship assistance.
Manage Accounts:
 Review, monitor, and document all account activities to ensure timely and accurate follow-up.
Educate & Empower:
 Help members understand their financial options and build skills to prevent future challenges.
Collaborate:
 Partner with teammates on skip tracing, repossessions, and loss-mitigation efforts — always with a people-first approach.
Stay Compliant:
 Ensure all communications and actions meet legal, regulatory, and policy requirements.
Who You Are
Fluent in 
Spanish and English
, with the ability to build trust and communicate with empathy.
Skilled at handling difficult conversations with professionalism and tact.
Organized, detail-oriented, and persistent — you don’t give up easily.
A self-starter who thrives in a remote work environment but values teamwork and accountability.
Pay & Benefits
Starting pay:
 $20.78/hour (based on experience)
Language proficiency incentive:
 Additional pay available for certified Spanish fluency. (must pass certification testing)
Comprehensive benefits:
 401(k) with match, health, dental, vision, HSA, PTO, life insurance, employee discounts, and more.
Why You’ll Love Working Here
At First Alliance Credit Union, we’re not your typical financial institution, we’re a community of people who care. You’ll join a team that approaches collections not as confrontation, but as 
collaboration.
 We believe in helping people rebuild, not just recover.
If you’re ready to bring heart, integrity, and resilience to a role that truly makes a difference, 
apply today
 and help us change what collections can mean.
description.requirements:
What You’ll Bring
Education:
 High school diploma or GED required; additional coursework or certifications in finance or communications a plus.
Experience:
 3–5 years in a financial institution, with at least 1 year directly in 
collections, member solutions, or account recovery.
Bilingual fluency in Spanish and English: 
essential for supporting our diverse membership.
Strong communication skills: 
you can balance empathy with accountability and build trust in tough conversations.
Problem-solving mindset: 
you think creatively to help members find real solutions.
Attention to detail: 
organized, accurate, and reliable with account documentation and follow-up.
Tech-savvy: 
confident using computers, online systems, and common software tools.
Team-oriented: 
works well independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.
How You Show Up
You believe in 
showing up, listening, and providing possibilities
 — the heart of our mission.
You bring 
Passion, Presence, and Persistence
 to every interaction.
You stay calm under pressure and welcome feedback as a way to grow.
You see change as opportunity, both for yourself and for the members you serve.
You look for ways to make a difference beyond your daily tasks, sharing ideas, stepping up, and supporting your team.
How Success Is Measured
You deliver excellent member experiences with compassion and integrity.
You make sound, timely decisions that protect both members and the credit union.
You follow policies and procedures with care and consistency.
You communicate clearly — in person, on the phone, and in writing.
Your work is accurate, compliant, and completed on time.
You contribute to the credit union’s overall mission and success.

description.description:
Mobile Branch Lead
Starting Pay:
 $54,273+ (depending on experience)
Schedule:
 Full-time, Exempt
What You’ll Do
The Mobile Branch Lead is both the heart and driver of First Alliance’s Mobile Branch. You’ll lead the team, manage daily operations, and be our top lending producer—all while bringing financial services directly into the community.
In this role, you will:
Lead & Motivate
 – Guide and support the Mobile Branch team to deliver outstanding member service.
Drive Growth
 – Build a strong loan pipeline and meet lending goals through proactive outreach and relationship building.
Keep Us Moving
 – Ensure the mobile branch is safe, ready, and running smoothly each day.
Engage the Community
 – Represent First Alliance at every stop, building connections with members and local organizations.
Coach & Develop
 – Provide daily feedback and mentorship to your team, helping them grow their skills and confidence.
 This is a hands-on leadership role where you’ll balance production, operations, and people leadership—all in a unique, community-focused environment.

3+ years of financial services experience (with at least 1 year in lending)

Tech-savvy and adaptable in a fast-moving environment

At First Alliance, we live by our mission: 
We show up. We listen to your story. We provide possibilities.
 As the Mobile Branch Lead, you’ll help us extend that promise out into the community in a very real way.
Benefits Include:
401(k) with employer match
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Health Savings Account

description.description:
Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture – our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, have the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real-world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.
We are looking for a candidate with the ability to thrive in an environment with complex software and hardware designs, take ownership and be responsible for the human-machine interface of a novel ophthalmic robotic platform. 
The Product Manager will help design the user interface of ForSight’s products, both graphical and physical, based on a deep understanding of clinical needs and environment. The Product Manager will define the clinical requirements for our systems, design validation studies to demonstrate the device effectiveness and safety, and execute these studies.
description.who we are: At ForSight Robotics, we are united behind our mission: we believe that robotic eye surgery is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we are expanding the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer in ophthalmic robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. We empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.
description.responsibilities:
●	Design workflows and operational logic to meet the needs of the OR team.
●	Define user requirements in collaboration with R&D and Regulatory Affairs.
●	Illustrate design ideas using storyboards and process flows.
●	Collaborate with industrial designers in designing physical interfaces (knobs, buttons, light indications etc.), and with graphical designers in designing graphical user interfaces.
●	Closely work with software developers and testers to understand the technical implementation of complex features, clarify requirements, and help define test methods.
●	Support the software development process in prioritization, sprint planning, features tuning, definition of done and more. 
●	Analyze the risks involved in operating ForSight’s product, potential user errors or misuse, and define control methods.
description.requirements:
●	BSc/BA in a relevant field from a recognized institution.
●	3+ years of experience in Product Management for software-driven products.
●	Superior ability to empathize with people and understand the human factor.
●	Exceptional communication and collaboration skills—verbal, written, and presentation.
●	Ability to work with and across various groups and levels of management within the organization, including other engineering groups, marketing, clinical, engineering, and regulatory.
●	Ability to apply user-centered design and usability engineering principles for product research, development, and design.

description.description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic and passionate senior software engineer to take a central role in our R&D team developing a surgical robotic platform that will revolutionize ophthalmic surgery. You will have the opportunity to work and design a first-in-market product within a dynamic, open, and fast-paced environment. 
You will be responsible for design and development of software that controls an advanced multidisciplinary medical robotic system.
description.who we are:
We are here to improve lives by restoring sight worldwide by a robotic platform for vision saving surgery. Our company will improve the way ophthalmic surgery is delivered to vision impaired individuals now and for decades to come.
We are rapidly growing, funded by leading international VCs, and are looking to expand our small, motivated, multi-disciplinary and phenomenal team. Joining us is an opportunity to work towards saving vision across the globe, collaborating with others to realize a dream, and tackle an enormous challenge that will help drive your career forward.
description.requirements:
B.A/B.Sc in computer sciences/engineering from a known academic institution.
5+ years of hands-on experience with Modern C++ on Linux platform.
Experience in software architecture and object oriented design.
Experience with multithreading.
Strong performance optimization skills.
Experience in computer graphics (OpenGL , Vulkan ) – advantage.
Experience in GPU programming (CUDA) – advantage.
Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills (Hebrew & English).

description.description:
Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture - our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, have the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real-world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.
As a Software Development Team Leader at ForSight, you will be at the forefront of driving and managing a dynamic team of talented software engineers specializing in C++ development on Linux platforms.
description.who we are:
We are here to improve lives by restoring sight worldwide by a robotic platform for vision saving surgery. Our company will improve the way ophthalmic surgery is delivered to vision impaired individuals now and for decades to come.
We are rapidly growing, funded by leading international VCs, and are looking to expand our small, motivated, multi-disciplinary and phenomenal team. Joining us is an opportunity to work towards saving vision across the globe, collaborating with others to realize a dream, and tackle an enormous challenge that will help drive your career forward.
description.responsibilities:
Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of software engineers.
Drive the design, development, and maintenance of complex software projects.
Ensure code quality, perform code reviews, and uphold best practices in software engineering.
Actively contribute to hands-on software development in C++ on Linux.
Coordinate with other teams and departments to ensure project alignment.
Ensure compliance with medical software development standards and regulations.
description.requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
At least 7 years of experience in software development.
At least 3 years of experience in leading a software team. 
Extensive hands-on experience with modern C++ on a Linux platform.
Strong background in software architecture and object-oriented design.
Experience with multithreading.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, communication skills, and leadership qualities.
Fluent in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

description.description:
Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture - our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, have the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real-world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.
We are looking for a candidate with the ability to thrive in an environment with complex software and hardware designs, take ownership and be responsible for system requirements, specifications and integration of a novel ophthalmic robotic platform. This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is motivated and passionate to make an impact in creating the next generation of ophthalmic robotic surgery.
description.who we are: At ForSight Robotics, we are united behind our mission: we believe that robotic ophthalmic surgery is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in ophthalmic robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.
description.responsibilities:
Define system architecture, requirements, verification and validation processes to ensure high-performance and reliability.
Collaborate with R&D, software, mechanical, and electrical teams to develop cutting-edge solutions.
Understanding the range of user, product, and marketing requirements, and converting them into practical system and subsystem level requirements.
Partition large system into subsystems, modules and components each of which clearly defined and straightforward to implement.
Participate in risk management activities and documentation.
Definition, planning and leading system design and integration using a cross-disciplinary team of engineers.
Drive verification and validation activities for the overall product, including subsystem and system level testing.
Work in collaboration with regulatory team to provide and maintain the regulatory design inputs and systems compliance.
Work with project and program managers to create and manage project schedules.
description.requirements:
BSc in System, Electrical, Electro-optical, Mechanical, Aeronautics or Computer Engineering from a leading university. Master’s degree is an advantage.
5+ years of experience in development of multi-disciplinary systems.
3+ years of experience in system engineering role within the medical device or defense industry.
Knowledge and understanding of Medical Device Compliance and Medical standards (60601, 62304, 14971, 13485 etc.) – advantage.
Experience with Medical Regulatory submissions – advantage.
Interpersonal skills and excellent teamwork - the ability to meet technical as well as human challenges.
Fluent in technical English – verbal & written.
Ability to self-manage and lead technically.
Knowledge of testing methodologies.
Good documentation skills.
